alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 22 at 12:11PM HST until March 22 at 12:45PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... At 1211 PM HST, heavy showers continue to fall at rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour across northern and windward Kauai. Streams remain elevated in these areas and additional heavy showers are expected through the afternoon. Emergency Management reports that Kuhio Highway is closed at the Hanalei River Bridge due to flooding and water was reported overflowing onto the highway at the Wainiha River. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Princeville, Kilauea, Hanalei, Wainiha, Haena, Alakai Swamp Trails, North Fork Wailua Trails, Na Pali State Park, Kokee State Park, Moloaa and Kalihiwai. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
